predicate.note: Frames file for 'cut' based on survey of initial sentences of big corpus and comparison with 'reduce'

roleset.name: slice

example.name: it slices, it dices, it makes julienne fries!
example.text: Trading companies can cut through the logjam that small-company owners often face.
example.arg: the logjam that small-company owners often face.

example.name: with source
example.text: Longer production runs would cut inefficiencies from adjusting machinery between production cycles.

roleset.note: I think that's the wrong syntactic parse, actually, but we'll go with it.

example.name: with EXT
example.text: Magna recently cut its quarterly divided in half.

example.name: with start and end points
example.text: Goody Products Inc cut its quarterly dividend to five cents a share from 11.5 cents a share.

example.name: but usually with just arg1
example.text: NL and Mr. Simmons cut the price they were proposing for Georgia Gulf.
example.arg: the price they were proposing for Georgia Gulf

roleset.name: various idiomatic usages

example.name: cut class
example.text: It was full of violence and gangs and kids cutting class

example.name: cut it
example.text: Many older athletes wonder if they can still cut it.

roleset.note: This encompasses a wide range of senses, but they all take basically the same PAS.

roleset.name: slice off

example.name: detassling
example.text: The seed companies cut off the tassels of each plant.

roleset.note: Just for the record, I'd like to point out that it isn't the seed companies that do this detasseling, but legions of Midwestern teenagers.
